alert.note: Alert for Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:43PM EST until December 21 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts...New Hampshire... Merrimack River AT Lawrence affecting Essex County. Merrimack River At Lowell affecting Middlesex and Essex Counties. Spicket River Near Methuen affecting Rockingham and Essex Counties. For the Merrimack River...including Lowell, Lawrence...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Spicket River...including Methuen...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spicket River near Methuen. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, In Salem, floodwaters encroach on lowest lying properties on Fiedler Ave. In Methuen, floodwaters encroach near properties on Horne Street, Morrison Court, and Broadway. In Lawrence, the river inundates Schofield Park and spreads onto Saratoga Street. Floodwaters reach onto Willow Street as well as nearby low lying buildings in the vicinity of Willow and Myrtle streets. In addition, floodwaters begin to inundate Spruce Street around the bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 8.4 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feet on 02/27/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
